in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), a place under the earth where the spirits of the dead go Compare
underworld (IN STORIES)
in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), the god of a place under the earth where the spirits of the dead go: Persephone is the name of the goddess kidnapped by Hades, king of the underworld.
More examplesFewer examplesIn Greek mythology, Hades was a dark, cold, mysterious place.Orpheus decides to bring Eurydice back from the dead by following her to Hades. Persephone became Hades' unwilling bride.When Orpheus sang to Hades and Persephone, his music was so beautiful that the Fates themselves cried.
